data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person who always faces forward must always take 10 steps forward and 9 steps left. Someone who always faces left must always take 10 steps forward and 9 steps right. Someone who always faces right must always take 10 steps backward and 9 steps right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The 4th step is the opposite of what you would take the first time around as the other 2 steps backwards add 4 steps on the second time back. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the instructions, you will return to the starting point after 7 steps. If you change your plan, you will have to do all of these steps in one step and then turn to the left. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take the same number of steps three times you will return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you go in one direction then you will be in the other direction. If you go in both directions then you will be getting back. So, the answer is no.

Turn right 3 times to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around then you take 8 steps. If you take 2 steps that should make a total of 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After every steps right to left, you always return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To get back to the starting point, you would take 3 steps, turn around, take 2 steps, take 7 steps, take 3 steps. If you took 3 steps, then you would take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step backward. The first step is always facing forward. The second step is taking a step backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person cannot come back to a starting point if you are facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps left. You never go back. Take 6 steps left. You never go left.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Once you face towards the starting point, we should always be facing forward. The first step is to move to the right, then the last is to the left. A person cannot be facing forward and forward at the same time, only one can be facing towards either end. Now, to go to the beginning, you must get back to the starting point at the same point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you are going in the opposite direction, you would have to walk back. If you are going in a straight line, you would have to turn the left on the right side. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, you can return to the starting point or the previous position in this sequence. So, the answer is no.

One must turn right in order to turn right. The first 2 instructions take 7 steps. The third instructions take 9 steps. The answer: Yes.

If you follow the directions, you return to the starting point. Turn around, take 1 step, then take 2 steps. The process of turning around and taking steps is not a repeat of, for example, going 7 steps, starting. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step and you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 6 steps in the first instructions. The first instructions take 1 step and the next instruct is 3 steps. Adding 2 steps to the first instructions subtract 3 from the second instructions, which does not subtract that many steps from the first instructions. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 5 steps you are back at the starting point. If you take 3 steps you are back at the starting point. Turn around and take 2 steps which are a total of 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

The starting point are 4 steps from the starting point. The number of steps is 1. Taking 7 steps = 1 additional step. Turning around is 1 extra step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In this sequence, your backwards steps are 8 steps left, 7 steps forward, and 2 steps right. The difference is that if you were at the beginning and always returned to your original position, you would see you had taken some steps to the right. The answer: Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you change your direction from the direction your facing forward you will have to change the direction you are facing. If you change your direction from the direction you are facing backward the first time you are facing forward then that change will be from the direction of your facing forward. If you change your direction from the direction you are facing backward the second time you are facing forward then the third change will be from the direction of your facing left. So, the answer is No.

If you turn around a person can return to to his starting point. So, the answer is yes.

One can never return to one’s starting point and go to the right way. Not necessarily. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is only one way to turn around but you can turn around by either taking 5 steps to the right or turn around by doing 5 steps to the left. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You could never run forwards backwards. You had to take two steps backward. So, the answer is No.

You can take 4 steps to take 3 steps. Taking 1 step is required to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

No, You cannot take 9 steps and turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

For each of the last two steps, you bring yourself back to the beginning step. If you are going 3 steps backward, you should take 2 steps left, and 10 steps right. Then take 10 steps right and 10 steps right. If you are going 8 steps backward, you should take 8 steps right. So, the answer is no.

Turning around takes you around. It takes one step to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you do not take back steps. So, the answer is No.

Whenever you face forward, you always take 5 steps left, and when you take 1 step backward you always take 2 steps right. If you always take 4 steps left, then you always take 2 steps right, while if you always take 6 steps left, you always take 8 steps left. If you always take 1 step backward when you take 2 steps right, then you always take 2 steps backward, while when you take 8 steps left, you always take 6 steps left. So, the answer is no.

Take 2 steps forward, 1 step backward, 6 steps forward, 1 step forward, 3 steps backward, 6 steps right, 3 steps left, 3 steps right. Each of these combinations are the same, so you do not go backwards. Walking backward instead of forward means you are walking in 4 directions as given by the instructions. Thus, the answer is no.

For the first procedure, you first have to take 2 steps. For the second procedure, you’ ve be taking 8 steps. For the third procedure, you’ ve be taking 10 steps. The first and second protocols return you to the starting point. They’ re the same process. So, the answer is yes.

To go backward, you must take steps away from the starting point. To go forward, you must take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

The first step to return to the starting spot would be to take a left turn. If you go back 6 times to the starting spot, you could turn back in 6 seconds. The first step to return to the starting point is to take 3 steps left. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is the point before the first 10 steps. It makes sense that if you make the first 10 steps toward the starting point, you will make the same 5 turns in a horizontal plane to get around to the point before the other 10 steps, so you turn around and turn around again and turn around to the end point. So, the answer is no.

It is safest if you always go forward. You would have to go backwards in order to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One can always return to the starting point when facing backward. If you follow the instructions, you will always face forward. Taking 5 steps right takes 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left takes 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left takes 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward takes 9 steps forward. If you follow the instructions, you will always face forward. If you repeat these directions, you will always go forward. So, the answer is Yes.
